Comment: When Reti popularized the hyper-modern opening named after him (1 Nf3), he had some profound positional concepts in mind, such as controlling the center from the wings instead of attacking it with pawns. But when confronted with such admirable tacticians as Dr. Treybal, the game became as wild as anything arising out of the King's Gambit.
Dr. Treybal, as black, occupies the center with pawns, in a classical style. Meanwhile, Reti tries to undermine it from the wings, a typical hyper-modern strategy.
